con:interface.name: APS Manager REST
con:interface.con:description: The REST API that can be used to manage the APS configuration.

con:method.name: GetSystemAddrs
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of system addresses

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: System address id

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: System address id

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: System address id

con:method.name: GetCredentialsList
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of APS credentials

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The credentials id

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The credentials id

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: the credentials id

con:method.name: GetFunctions
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of APS functions

con:parameter.con:name: name
con:parameter.con:description: Return only APS functions matching the specified name expression; '%' mechanism can be used, e.g. '%Get' or 'External%'

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The function id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The function id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The function id (could be a name)

con:method.name: GetFunctionRoles
con:method.con:description: Retrieve APS roles including a given APS function

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The function id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:method.name: GetFunctionUsers
con:method.con:description: Retrieve APS users allowed to execute a given APS function

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The function id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:method.name: GetRoles
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of APS roles

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS rode id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS role id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS role id (could be a name)

con:method.name: GetRoleUsers
con:method.con:description: Retrieve APS users having a given APS role

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The role id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:method.name: GetRoleFunctions
con:method.con:description: Retrieve APS functions allowed for a given APS role

con:parameter.con:name: roleId
con:parameter.con:description: The role id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:method.name: AddRoleFunction
con:method.con:description: Add a function in the allowed set for a given APS role

con:parameter.con:name: roleId
con:parameter.con:description: The role id (could be a name)

con:method.name: DeleteRoleFunctions
con:method.con:description: Delete a function from the allowed set for a given APS role

con:parameter.con:name: roleId
con:parameter.con:description: The role id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: functionId
con:parameter.con:description: The to-be-deleted function id

con:method.name: GetUsers
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of APS users

con:parameter.con:name: credentials
con:parameter.con:description: Return all the users having a matching UsernamePassword credentials; '%' mechanism can be used too. Ex: 'Adm%'

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The user id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The user id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: the user id (could be a name)

con:method.name: GetUserFunctions
con:method.con:description: Retrieve functions allowed for a given APS user

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The user id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:method.name: GetUserCredentials
con:method.con:description: Retrieve credentials assigned to a given APS user

con:parameter.con:name: userId
con:parameter.con:description: The user id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:method.name: GetUserRoles
con:method.con:description: Retrieve roles assigned to a given APS user

con:parameter.con:name: userId
con:parameter.con:description: The user id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:method.name: AddUserRole
con:method.con:description: Assign an APS role to a given APS user

con:parameter.con:name: userId
con:parameter.con:description: The user id (could be a name)

con:method.name: DeleteUserRole
con:method.con:description: Unassign an APS role from a given APS user

con:parameter.con:name: userId
con:parameter.con:description: The user id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: roleId
con:parameter.con:description: The role id (could be a name)

con:method.name: GetComponents
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of APS components.

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS component id (could be a code)

con:method.name: ExecuteEngine
con:method.con:description: Create an event to execute a given engine in the given APS node

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS engine id (could be the code)

con:parameter.con:name: node
con:parameter.con:description: Code of the node that will execute the engine

con:parameter.con:name: msgid
con:parameter.con:description: Id of the message to process during the execution

con:parameter.con:name: businessmsgid
con:parameter.con:description: Business Id of the message to process during the execution

con:parameter.con:name: msgcat
con:parameter.con:description: Category (code) of the messages to process during the execution

con:parameter.con:name: fromSys
con:parameter.con:description: System (code) that sent the messages to process during the execution

con:parameter.con:name: toSys
con:parameter.con:description: Target system (code) of the messages to process during the execution

con:method.name: InactivateComponent
con:method.con:description: Inactivate an APS engine. The status of the engine will be changed in the dababase.

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS component id (could be the code)

con:method.name: ReactivateComponent
con:method.con:description: Reactivate an APS engine. The status of the engine will be changed in the dababase.

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS component id (could be the code)

con:method.name: ReinitComponent
con:method.con:description: Reinitialize the in-memory properties of a given component in the given APS node

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS component id (could be the code)

con:parameter.con:name: node
con:parameter.con:description: Code of the node that will re-init the component. If not set, the re-init will occur on the current node. The ALL value means that every 'active' node will re-init the APS component.

con:method.name: RestartComponent
con:method.con:description: Unblock future executions of a given component in the given APS node

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS component id (could be the code)

con:parameter.con:name: node
con:parameter.con:description: Code of the node that will unblock future executions. If not set, the execution will be unblock on the current node. The ALL value means that every 'active' node will unblock the APS component.

con:method.name: StopComponent
con:method.con:description: Stop the execution of a given component and block future executions in the given APS node

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS component id (could be the code)

con:parameter.con:name: node
con:parameter.con:description: Code of the node that will stop the execution. If not set, the execution will stopped on the current node. The ALL value means that every 'active' node will stop the APS component.

con:method.name: GetKeystores
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of keystores

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: Keystore id (could be a code)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: Keystore id (could be a code)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: Keystore id (could be a code)

con:method.name: GetMapDataSets
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of mapped data sets

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:method.name: CreateMapDataSet
con:method.con:description: Add a new mapped data set

con:method.name: CreateMapDataSetElem
con:method.con:description: Add a new mapped data set element

con:method.name: GetMapDataSetElem
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a mapped data set element

con:parameter.con:name: elemId
con:parameter.con:description: The mapped data set element id

con:method.name: UpdateMapDataSetElem
con:method.con:description: Update a given mapped data set element

con:parameter.con:name: elemId
con:parameter.con:description: The mapped data set element id

con:method.name: DeleteMapDataSetElem
con:method.con:description: Delete a given mapped data set element

con:parameter.con:name: elemId
con:parameter.con:description: The mapped data set element id

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The mapped data set id (could be a code)

con:method.name: UpdateMapDataSet
con:method.con:description: Update a given mapped data set

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The mapped data set id

con:method.name: DeleteMapDataSet
con:method.con:description: Delete a given mapped data set

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The mapped data set id (could be a code)

con:method.name: GetMapDataSetElems
con:method.con:description: Retrieve all the elements of a given mapped data set

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: The mapped data set id (could be a code)

con:method.name: GetMsgCats
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of message categories

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: Message category id (could be a code)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: Message category id (could be a code)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: Message category id (could be a code)

con:method.name: GetMsgTypes
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of message types

con:parameter.con:name: code
con:parameter.con:description: Return the message type having the specified code (MsgCat-FromSys-ToSys)

con:parameter.con:name: msgCat
con:parameter.con:description: Return only message types for the specified message category id

con:parameter.con:name: fromSys
con:parameter.con:description: Return only message types sent by the specified system id

con:parameter.con:name: toSys
con:parameter.con:description: Return only message types setn to the specified system id

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: Message type id (could be a code like this MsgCat-FromSys-ToSys)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: Message type id (could be a code like this MsgCat-FromSys-ToSys)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: Message type id (could be a code like this MsgCat-FromSys-ToSys)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: Message type id (could be a code like this MsgCat-FromSys-ToSys)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: Message type id (could be a code like this MsgCat-FromSys-ToSys)

con:method.name: GetNodes
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of APS nodes.

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:method.name: ClearCaches
con:method.con:description: Clear caches on the specified APS node(s)

con:parameter.con:name: node
con:parameter.con:description: Code of the node that will clear the caches. If not set, the caches will be cleared on the current node. The ALL value means that every 'active' node will clear the caches.

con:parameter.con:name: caches
con:parameter.con:description: Comma separated list of cache names to be cleared. If not specified all the caches will be cleared. ALL means that all chaches will be cleared.

con:method.name: HealthCheck
con:method.con:description: Retrieve health check data of the current APS node

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS node id (could be a code)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS node id (could be a code)

con:method.name: GetProperties
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of APS properties

con:parameter.con:name: name
con:parameter.con:description: Return only APS properties matching the specified name expression; '%' mechanism can be used, e.g. 'Web%'

con:parameter.con:name: node
con:parameter.con:description: Return only APS properties relevant for the specified APS node id; 'ANY' means properties relevant for all nodes and for specific nodes. When not present, return only the properties relevant for all nodes

con:parameter.con:name: component
con:parameter.con:description: Return only APS properties relevant for the specified APS component id; 'ANY' means properties relevant for all components and for specific components. When not present, return only the properties relevant for all components

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS property id

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS property id

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: APS property id

con:method.name: GetSystemSenders
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of system senders

con:parameter.con:name: sendertype
con:parameter.con:description: Return only senders allowed for the specified sender type id (could be a code)

con:parameter.con:name: system
con:parameter.con:description: Return only senders allowed for the specified system id (could be a code)

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: System sender id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:name: id
con:parameter.con:description: System sender id (could be a name)

con:parameter.con:description: The sender id (could be a name)

con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of sender types

con:method.con:description: Add a message type in the allowed set for a given external system signer

con:method.name: GetExternalSystems
con:method.con:description: Retrieve a paged array of external systems

con:parameter.con:name: banks
con:parameter.con:description: Return only the bank systems (true) or the none bank systems (false)

con:parameter.con:name: offset
con:parameter.con:description: The 'page' from where to start to get results; Use it together with limit; Page numbering starts with 0

con:parameter.con:name: limit
con:parameter.con:description: Page max size, i.e. the maximum number of returned entities; Use it together with offset; Default value is 500

con:parameter.con:description: External system id (could by a code)
